content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as central storage.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5) with drop at (x=0.5, y=20.5).

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research.
• Boiler at (x=-5.5, y=24.0) supplying thermal energy.
• Steam Engine at (x=-0.5, y=24.5) delivering power output.
• Offshore Pump at (x=-7.5, y=25.5) supporting fluid intake.
• Electricity Group with small electric poles at (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5) and (x=1.5, y=22.5).
• Dual PipeGroups forming the fluid network at (x=-10.5, y=16.5) & (x=-12.5, y=18.5) and at (x=-8.5, y=20.5) & (x=-2.5, y=21.5).

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine at (x=1.5, y=19.5) running the copper‑cable recipe.
• Burner Inserter at (x=1.5, y=17.5).
• Input Chest at (x=2.5, y=17.5) for copper plates.
• Output Chest at (x=1.5, y=21.5) dispatching copper cable.
• Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-5.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=0.5, y=17.5) linking outputs.
• Additional Burner Inserters at (x=2.5, y=16.5) and (x=3.5, y=17.5).

### Copper Extraction System (adjacent to the copper smelting furnace)
Consists of:
• Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=23.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=22.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=24.5).
• Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-3.5, y=26.5).
• Chest Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=27.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=26.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=28.5).
• Belt Source Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=25.5).

### Extraction Belt Depot at position (x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as the belt depot.
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=4.5, y=15.5) for copper plate conveyance.
• Depot Burner Inserter at (x=3.5, y=14.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=3.5, y=13.5).

### Belt Connection Target Setup for Copper Extraction
Consists of:
• Extraction Source: Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5).
• Extraction Inserter at (x=4.5, y=15.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=5.5, y=15.5).
• Manual Transport Belt Chain comprising:
 – Horizontal segments at (x=7.5, y=15.5) and (x=8.5, y=15.5)
  • Note: Blocked placement at (x=6.5, y=15.5).
 – Vertical segments at (x=8.5, y=14.5), (x=8.5, y=13.5), (x=8.5, y=12.5) and (x=8.5, y=11.5)
  • Note: Occupancy error at (x=8.5, y=10.5).
• New Target Inserter at (x=8.5, y=9.5) with pickup at (x=8.5, y=10.5) and drop at (x=8.5, y=8.5).
• Belt Chain Burner Inserter Refueling Subsystem deploying:
 – Burner Inserters at (x=6.5, y=9.5), (x=7.5, y=9.5) and (x=8.5, y=9.5) with updated fuel levels (recent logs indicate reductions down to around 6 units).
 – Additional Burner Inserters at (x=3.5, y=14.5) and (x=5.5, y=14.5).

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• CORE MODULE SUPPORT & RESOURCE FEED:
 – Furnaces at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) and (x=-4.0, y=21.0) lack necessary ingredients; maintain a consistent material supply.
 – The Assembling Machine at (x=1.5, y=19.5) in the Copper Cable Factory suffers from power deficits; verify electrical connectivity and resource inputs.
 – The Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) remains underpowered; reinforce and balance the power distribution network.
 – The Boiler at (x=-5.5, y=24.0) is unfueled; initiate prompt and regular refuel dispatches.
 – The Steam Engine at (x=-0.5, y=24.5) is not connected due to missing liquid input; re‑align fluid connections appropriately.

• BURNER INSERTER FUEL MANAGEMENT:
 – Multiple burner inserters across structures (including those at positions (x=21.5, y=10.5), (x=0.5, y=21.5), (x=-3.5, y=23.5), (x=-4.5, y=26.5) and (x=-3.5, y=27.5)) are displaying “out of fuel” or low fuel warnings; ensure a robust, accessible fuel supply. Recent logs show further decreases in fuel levels within the refueling subsystem.

• TILE PLACEMENT & OCCUPANCY:
 – Persisting blocked placement at (x=6.5, y=15.5) and the occupancy error at (x=8.5, y=10.5) require verification of tile availability and pre-clearance of obstructions before placement.

• GLOBAL SYSTEM CONFIGURATION:
 – Although peripheral auto‑optimization cycles have resolved transient NO_FUEL and NO_POWER warnings in fringe modules, core integration issues persist—particularly in power distribution and resource (material/fuel/liquid) supply; focus troubleshooting efforts on these central system alignments.
